page.title: 19ST GERMAINES CHURCH
page.content: { Tourism}:St.Germain's Church Thurlby -------------------------------------- The church of St.Germain stands in a very peaceful setting,a mile or so from RAF Swinderby.People from all over the world visit the graves of theirrelatives who were in the{Armed {Forces. } Since 1967 it has been part of the Bassingham group of parishes. Extensive repairs to the roof and minor repairs to the walls were done in 1980/81.The interior was redecorated by the parishioners. {Rose Sunday}is held on the first Sunday in July when the church is filled with roses of every hue and colour.This was introduced by Sir Benjamin Bromhead a descendent of Gorville Bromhead {V.C.}(hero of Rork's Drift) --------------------------------------
